text.text_translated: Both types of accidents are very rare, but boats and trains can make a bridge fall down for different reasons. With trains, the speed of the impact can bring a bridge down. With boats, the very large weight they have can cause a fall down. This can happen even when they move slowly. The best way to avoid bridge failures is to plan for them. Modern technology that can detect weakness in the structure, safer work environments, and better designs can all help to reduce these terrible accidents.
